definition: knee/(Internet slang) to kneel down (in admiration)

sentences.english: Lie on your back with your legs spread or raise your knees to your head.
sentences.chinese: 平躺，張開雙腿或者把膝蓋擡到靠近頭部的地方。

sentences.english: Pinocchio's knees are made of wood.
sentences.chinese: 皮諾丘的膝蓋是用木頭做的。

sentences.english: His knee is misshapen or unequipped to move.
sentences.chinese: 他的膝蓋有點正常，也不能動。

sentences.english: The right leg performs knee flexion while theleft knee undergoes knee extension.
sentences.chinese: 右腿膝蓋彎曲，左膝進行膝蓋拉伸。

sentences.english: The right leg performs knee flexion while theleft knee undergoes knee extension.
sentences.chinese: 右腿膝蓋彎曲，左膝進行膝蓋拉伸。

sentences.english: He has very thin legs and knobbly knees.
sentences.chinese: 他腿很細，膝蓋呈圓球狀突出。

sentences.english: The old basketball star walks gingerly on aching knees.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的籃球明星會因膝蓋的傷痛步履蹣跚。

sentences.english: Facer fell off the ladder and skinned his knees.
sentences.chinese: 費塞從梯子上跌下來，膝蓋破皮了。

sentences.english: I've broken my kneels, but not my head.
sentences.chinese: 不過我膝蓋摔壞了，腦袋可沒有壞。

sentences.english: The child's head is level with his father's knee.
sentences.chinese: 這孩子的頭與他父親的膝蓋齊平。

sentences.english: Even the kneecaps—no larger than macadamia nuts—are preserved.
sentences.chinese: 連不比夏威夷堅果大的膝蓋骨，也保存下來了。

sentences.english: Ms Mastenbroek said that behind your elbows and knees are also great points for perfume.
sentences.chinese: 馬斯滕布魯克女士表示，手肘和膝蓋也是不錯的位置。

sentences.english: She held her head high as a small trickle of blood ran down from her bruised knee.
sentences.chinese: 她高高揚起頭，青腫的膝蓋上一滴血慢慢流下來。

sentences.english: The boy fell and scraped the skin off his knee.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩摔了一跤，擦破了膝蓋上的皮。

sentences.english: She covered her mouth with her hand, another wave of chills flowing over her as her knees literally knocked together.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住嘴，又一陣惡寒讓她全身發抖，膝蓋打顫。

sentences.english: Butler right knee injury. Will not return tonight.
sentences.chinese: 巴特勒右膝蓋受傷，今天晚上不會重新出場了。

definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
cervical vertebra/the seven cervical vertebrae in the neck of humans and most mammals
hand and foot/movement of limbs/action/trick/step in a procedure (CL: 道[dao4])
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
